paper_title.en: Cu2ZnSnS4 thin films annealed in H2S atmosphere for solar cell absorber prepared by pulsed laser deposition

description.en: Cu2ZnSnS4 (CZTS) precursors were prepared by pulsed laser deposition while controlling the energy density to eliminate grains of Cu-Sn-S compounds. The precursor prepared with an energy density of 0.7 J/cm(2) was flat and of better quality than the precursor prepared with an energy density of 1.5 J/cm(2). The precursors were annealed in N-2 + H2S (5%) atmosphere. As a result of annealing, the decrease of the compositional ratio of sulfur was suppressed and the films became nearly stoichiometric. Some peaks in the an X-ray diffraction pattern of thin films are attributed to (112), (220), (312), and (200) planes of CZTS. The direct band-gap energy of the film annealed at 500 degrees C was about 1.5 eV, which is very close to the optimum value for a solar-cell absorber, and hence was used for a solar cell. The CZTS thin film solar cell with an active area of 0.12 cm(2) showed an open-circuit voltage of 336 mV, a short-circuit current of 6.53 mA/cm(2), a fill factor of 0.46, and a conversion efficiency of 0.64%.

paper_title.en: Optical and electrical properties of organic films prepared by RF plasma chemical vapor deposition using mixed naphthalene and propane source

description.en: Organic films were prepared by RF plasma chemical vapor deposition (CVD) using naphthalene (named naph), propane (prop), and naphthalene mixed propane (naph-prop). All of the samples showed broadband emission of photoluminescence. In IR transmission, aromatic ring out-of-plane C-H bending, C-H stretching, and C = C stretching vibrations were observed in naph-prop sample, and all of the absorption was similar to naph sample. The aliphatic C-H, stretching vibrations also were founded in all samples. The conductivity of the naph-prop sample was 1.8 x 10(-7) S/cm, and this value was large compared to the samples that only prepared by naphthalene or propane. The naph-prop sample showed the space charge limited current (SCLC) at the higher voltage region.

paper_title.en: Pre-annealing of precursors of Cu2ZnSnS4 thin films prepared by sol-gel sulfurizing method

description.en: Cu2ZnSnS4 (CZTS) thin films were prepared by sulfurizing pre-annealed oxyhydrate precursors deposited by the sol-gel method. The precursors were obtained by coating solutions containing copper(II) acetate monohydrate, zinc(II) acetate dihydrate, tin(II) chloride dihydrate, 2-methoxyethanol, and monoethanolamine on a soda lime glass (SLG). By pre-annealing the precursors in air at 560 degrees C, chemical composition of films was almost stoichiometric, transmittance of IR region was increased and number of void was decreased while chemical composition of CZTS films deviated considerably from stoichiometry when the precursors were annealed N-2 + H-2 (5%) atmosphere at 460 and 560 degrees C.

paper_title.en: Optical properties of Cu2ZnSnS4 thin films prepared by sol-gel and sulfurization method

description.en: Cu2ZnSnS4 (CZTS) thin films were prepared by a sot-gel sulfurization method. One sample (CZTS1) was stoichiometric (Cu Zn : Sn : S = 2.0 : 1.0 : 1.0 : 4.0) and another sample (CZTS2) was Cu poor and Zn rich (Cu : Zn : Sn : S = 1.87 : 1.15 1.00 : 4.00). Photoluminescence from the CZTS thin films was studied as a function of excitation power and temperature. The CZTS1 and CZTS2 thin films showed a broad luminescence between 1.1 and 1.4 eV and between 1.1 and 1.45 eV respectively. The peak photon energy of the photoluminescence was shifted to higher energy side when the excitation power was increased. The origin of the photoluminescence was attributed to donor-acceptor pair recombination with activation energy of 39 and 59 meV for CZTS1 and CZTS2 respectively. Transmittance spectra for the thin films were studied as a function of temperature. The band gap energy shift was smaller than by 10 meV with increasing temperature from 22 to 300 K.

paper_title.en: Fabrication of Cu2ZnSnS4 thin-film solar cell prepared by pulsed laser deposition

description.en: A thin-film solar cell based on a CU2ZnSnS4 (CZTS) absorber layer deposited by pulsed laser deposition has been fabricated with an Al:ZnO (n-type) window layer and a US buffer layer. Some peaks attributed to (112), (200), (220), and (312) planes of CZTS appeared in an X-ray diffraction pattern of a thin film. The composition of the film was Sn-rich and the band gap energy was approximately 1.5 eV. A CZTS film annealed at 500 degrees C in an atmosphere of N-2 had optical characteristics suitable for use in an absorber layer of a thin-film solar cell and was used for a solar cell. The CZTS thin-film solar cell with an active area of 0.092 cm(2) showed an open-circuit voltage of 546 mV, a short-circuit current of 6.78 mA/cm(2) a fill factor of 0.48, and a conversion efficiency of 1.74%.

paper_title.en: Preparation of Cu2ZnSnS4 thin films by sulfurizing sol-gel deposited precursors

description.en: CU2ZnSnS4 (CZTS) thin films were prepared by sulfurizing precursors deposited by the sot-gel method. Copper (II) acetate monohydrate, zinc (II) acetate dihydrate and tin (II) chloride dihydrate were used as the starting materials of the sol-gel method, and 2methoxyethanol and monoethanolamine were used as the solvent and the stabilizer, respectively. The solution was spin coated on soda lime glass substrates and dried at 300 degrees C. The coated glasses were sulfurized by annealing at 500 degrees C in a hydrogen sulfide-containing atmosphere. The annealed thin films showed X-ray diffraction peaks attributed to the single phase CZTS. The chemical composition of the films was almost stoichiometric and the band gap energy was 1.49 eV at room temperature. (C) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Donor-acceptor pair recombination luminescence from Cu2ZnSnS4 bulk single crystals

description.en: Photoluminescence from Cu2ZnSnS4 bulk single crystals was studied as a function of temperature and excitation power density. The bulk single crystals showed a broad luminescence between 1.1 and 1.45 eV. The peak energy of the photoluminescence was shifted to higher energy side when the excitation power density was increased. The origon of the photoluminescence was attributed to donor-acceptor pair recombination with an activation energy of 48 meV. (c) 2006 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim.

publication_name.en: PHYSICA STATUS SOLIDI A-APPLICATIONS AND MATERIALS SCIENCE

description.en: Transient optical loss in a CaGa2S4:Ce3+ single crystal was observed by a nanosecond pump-probe spectroscopy. When the probe beam with a wavelength of 460 to 620 run passed through the excited sample, its intensity reduced to about 0.8 times of the intensity after passing through the unexcited sample. A large excited state absorption cross section of a Ce3+ ion, sigma(ESA-prb) = 7.4 x 10(-17) cm(2) was evaluated from the result of the pump beam energy dependence of the ratio of the probe intensity with pumping to that without pumping. This report suggested that excited state absorption prevents stimulated emission in CaGa2S4:Ce3+. (c) 2006 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim.

publication_name.en: PHYSICA STATUS SOLIDI C - CURRENT TOPICS IN SOLID STATE PHYSICS, VOL 3, NO 8

description.en: Bright broadband luminescence with a full width at half maximum (FWHM) of 200 nm was found in Pb-doped CaGa2S4. From the observation of photoluminescence (PL) and photoluminescence excitation (PLE) spectra, the Pb dopants were found to form Tl+-type centers in CaGa2S4. Temporal decay curves of PL intensity under pulsed excitation showed two decay times of short (similar to 10(-8) s) and long (similar to 10(-6) s). The experimental results suggest that there are two excitation processes of the electrons in the S-1(0) (6s(2)) ground state to the (3)p(1), P-3(2) and P-1(1) (6s6p) excited states: directed optical excitation and indirected excitation via trap states. This is the first observation of photoluminescence from Pb-doped CaGa2S4. (c) 2006 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim.

paper_title.en: Characterization Of Cu2ZnSnS4 thin films prepared by photo-chemical deposition

description.en: Cu2ZnSnS4 (CZTS) thin films were prepared by post-annealing films of metal sulfides Of Cu2S, ZnS and SnS2 precursors deposited on soda-lime glass substrates by photo-chemical deposition (PCD) from aqueous solution containing CuSO4, ZnSO4, SnSO4 and Na2S2O3. In this study, sulfurization was employed to prepare high quality CZTS thin films. Deposited films of metal sulfides were annealed in a furnace in an atmosphere of N-2 or N-2+H2S(5%) at the temperature of 300 degrees, 400 degrees or 500 degrees C. The sulfured films showed X-ray diffraction peaks from (112), (220), and (312) planes of CZTS and the peaks became sharp by an increase in the sulfurization temperature. CZTS thin film annealed in atmosphere of N2 was S-poor. After annealing atmosphere was changed from N-2 into N-2+H2S(5%), the decrease of a compositional ratio of sulfur could be suppressed.

paper_title.en: Application of Pb-doped CaGa2S4 as a fluorescent light

description.en: Pb-doped CaGa2S4 powder-dispersed resin was spread on a glass plate and a flat panel fluorescent lamp excited by UV-LEDs was fabricated. The device showed yellow-red luminescence. Under black light excitation of 352 nm, the device emitted yellow luminescence. An attempt was made to obtain white luminescence by mixing Ce-doped CaGa2S4 powder with Pb-doped CaGa2S4 powder. But the blue-green luminescence was still weak and other blue luminescent materials for mixing are necessary. (c) 2006 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim.

paper_title.en: Epitaxial growth of Cu2ZnSnS4 thin films by pulsed laser deposition

description.en: Cu2ZnSnS4 thin films were grown epitaxially on GaP substrates by pulsed laser deposition (PLD). The band gap of the films was about 1.5 eV from the absorption spectra. In XRD patterns, two CTZS peaks, (004) and (008), were observed at the vicinity of GaP peaks of (200) and (400), respectively. The Cu2ZnSnS4 thin films deposited at substrate temperatures of 350 and 400 degrees C were nearly stoichiometric and showed 4 poles observed at about 48 degrees in pole figure measurement, indicating that the samples were oriented in plane. (c) 2006 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim.

paper_title.en: Preparation of Ce-doped CaGa2S4 crystals by melting method and their optical properties

description.en: Transparent Ce-doped CaGa2S4 bulk crystals were synthesized using a self-flux method. These bulks had high transmittance in luminescence region of 450 nm to 600 nm. Dependence of luminescence intensity on excitation power was observed using a pulsed dye laser excitation.. Saturation of luminescence intensity was observed for the first time in this material when the excitation power density exceeded 10 MW/cm(2). This saturation was assumed to result from excited state absorption (ESA), and analyzed with a 4-level transition model involving ESA.

description.en: Upconversion luminescence and photoluminescence (PL) from Er-doped CaGa2S4 crystal were investigated. Opaque polycrystalline samples were grown by the solid state method and transparent single crystalline samples by the self-flux method. The samples were excited by a laser line of 532 nm, 514.5 nm, 488.0 nm, 476.5 nm or 457.9 nm for the observation of upconversion luminescence and excited by a laser line of 532 nm, 457.9 nm or 325 nm for PL measurement. Four upconversion luminescence bands were observed at 385 nm, 4 10 nm, 455 nm and 495 nm which were attributed to the transitions of (4)G(11/2) -> I-4(15/2), H-2(9/2) -> I-4(15/2), F-4(5/2) -> I-4(15/2) and (4)G(11/2) -> I-4(13/2) in Er3+ ion, respectively, from the samples grown by the solid state method and by the self-flux method.

description.en: The optical properties of Sn-doped and Sn-and Ce-codoped CaGa2S4 polycrystals were studied. Broadband (green to infrared) and bright photoluminescence was observed under 313 nm, 345 nm and 365 nm excitation. The full width at half maximum of Sn-doped CaGa2S4 PL spectra was more than 300 nm.
